result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad William Kessler 00659723 is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Chad William Kessler 00659723 was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive to Count 4.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: Count 4

CO: RMW , REP: Kaurie Jeske, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Steven L. Miller appears via phone with permission of the Court  DF:  Chad William Kessler   00659723 appeared from jail. Case called at 10:00 a.m. Court notes this is the time set for the issuance of oral decision. Court issues the decision. Regarding the Waiver of the Right to Counsel at trial, Court is satisfied the colloquy was adequate and the product of a deliberate decision by the DE. Regarding retrospective competency at the time of trial to represent self, Court denies the postconviction motion. Court will issue an Order. Atty Miller is requesting from the Court reporter a transcript of today's hearing and the hearing on March 6th. Court directs Atty Miller to complete the form to request the transcripts.
and Exhibit's #1 thru #10. hml
Oral ruling on March 11, 2019 at 10:00 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Steven L. Miller   DF:  Chad William Kessler   00659723 appeared from jail. Case called at 2:27 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time to consider motion for postconviction relief. Atty Miller says the State stipulates to the psychological exam. That has been attached to the motion. Has filed additional exhibits. Court O/R Exhibit's #1-#8 . Would like to address the Waiver of counsel and competent to represent self at the time of trial. Will be calling client to the Stand. Argues the colloquy was inadequate and did not address DE's mental health. DA Nieskes responds. Atty Miller calls Chad K. to the Stand. S/T Chad K. Direct by Atty Miller. Cross by DA Nieskes. PL Exhibit's #9 (motion filed by DE before trial). PL Exhibit #10 (motion filed by DE before trial). O/R Exhibit's #9 & #10. Court directs DE. DA Nieskes gives argument. Requesting Court deny motion. Atty Miller gives argument. DA Nieskes responds. Court will take the matter under advisement. Court gives Atty Miller permission to appear via phone. Court orders DE to remain in our jail until after 03-11-2019 decision.  Oral ruling scheduled for March 11, 2019 at 10:00 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Steven L. Miller appears via phone with permission of the Court   DF:  Chad William Kessler   00659723 appeared from jail.  Case called at 10:03 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for a hearing as a competency report was filed in the case pending in Branch 3. DE was found competent by reporter. Atty Miller has received a copy of the report. Requesting a motion hearing be scheduled to address competency and the postconviction motion. DA Nieskes believes DE would be returning to prison unless there is an order regarding DE to stay here. Court will not hold DE here on this matter. Court addresses the retrospective evaluation. Atty Miller will be addressing. Court will not be ordering any further evaluations. DA Nieskes requesting that if Atty Miller is requesting a county paid retrospective evaluation that the Corporation Counsel be copied in on the request. Atty Miller will do so.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 9, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on December 3, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Staying the Order for Competency Examination pending the Competency Evaluation in 18CF689. RMW signed 11/7/18 - E: DA & Atty. eif
Review on November 12, 2018 at 07:45 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Steven L. Miller   DF:  Chad William Kessler   00659723 appeared from jail. Atty Dennis Schuh appears via phone from DHS. Case called at 3:27 p.m. Court notes this is a continued review hearing regarding DE's competency on postconviction matter. Court notes DE has a new charge in 18CF689. DA Nieskes has filed a motion regarding competency in that matter. See's no reason why another evaluation needs to be completed. Requesting this matter be reset for another status conference. Atty Miller responds. No objection. Atty Schuh responds. Atty Rohl just adds that there are different standards to be met. Still objects to the State's request. Court will issue a stay of previous Order to DHS.  Review scheduled for November 12, 2018 at 07:45 am.
from State of Wisconsin Dept. of Health Services. gme

signed by RMW reaffirmed the previous order for competency. WFU to provide an examination, or appear for a RH on 11/7/18 to show cause why it has not be complied with the order. E: DA, Atty, email: Vicki S. & Staff at WFU & fax: WFU. eif
Hearing on November 7, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Steven L. Miller   DF:  Chad William Kessler   00659723 appeared from jail. Atty Liz Rohl appears for Corporation Counsel. Case called at 11:29 a.m. Court requested a hearing based on a letter received from the State Department of Health regarding competency exam on a postconviction matter. DA Nieskes makes statement. Requesting either Court appoint Dr. Minter privately or return DE to DOC and direct department hire a professional. Atty Miller responds. Atty Rohl makes statement regarding who to cover costs. Parties argue the retrospective competency examination and if it can be done. DA Nieskes addresses possible Daubert motion. State would cover current competency exam but not pay for retrospective exam. Atty Miller responds. DA Nieskes addresses the letter from DHS. Court addresses DE's current competency. Court did prepare Order. Should be up to DHS to determine. DA Nieskes makes request of the Court to hold DE here and set a short turn around for hearing. Court will set another review hearing for next week. Atty Miller is fine with DE remaining in St Croix County Jail until the next hearing. Court will issue an Order confirming previous Court Order that was submitted to DHS.  Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

regarding unable to proceed with the Competency Evaluation because it is post-sentencing filed by Deborah L. Collins Psy. D. (to tfy). eif
signed by RMW 10/17/18 - E: DA, Atty, Fax: WFU, Email: Vicki S. & WFU Staff. eif
Status conference on November 16, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Young, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Steven L. Miller   DF:  Chad William Kessler   00659723 appeared from jail. Case called at 2:22 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a hearing on post conviction motions. DA Nieskes states DE is requesting competency hearing. Regarding the question of retrospective competency at the time of trial, State objects. Atty Miller states there is a joint request to have an expert appointed for an exam but is asking for retrospective competency at the time of trial. Court questions on where DE would go if found not competent. DA Nieskes responds. Atty Miller gives argument. Court finds that competency has been raised on DE's behalf to cooperate in the the postconviction motion and will Order that examination. DA Nieskes requesting Court contact Dr. Minter. If available within in the next 5-7, DE remain here. Court notes that the forensic unit appoints. If Dr. Minter is appointed, Court will have DE stay here. Regarding the retrospective request, Court will see if the examiner can do it and proceed from there.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Deiss, CLERK: Liddle DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Chad William Kessler appeared from jail. Case called at 10:05 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for sentencing. Court has received a copy of the report from the probation agent. Both parties have received a copy of the report and no corrections to be noted. DA Nieskes gives sentencing arguments. No Victims present today but victim impact statement was filed. Atty Schwab gives sentencing arguments. No objection to the restitution amounts. Not eligible for the challenge incarceration program but requesting if prison is ordered that the DE be found eligible for the substance abuse program. DE makes statement and requesting a mistrial due to incompetent counsel at the jury trial. Court will not address postconviction matters today. 20 days to file appeal. Regarding Atty Schwab, take effective date court appointed and will end until files Notice of Intent. Court will file an Order to that effect and Atty Schwab to file bill within 10 days. All fines, costs and restitution to be reduced to a civil judgment. Any bond on file to apply and any prison wages.

Sentencing hearing on August 30, 2017 at 10:00 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. DA: Michael Edward Nieskes and ADA Kaley Walker  DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Chad William Kessler appeared from jail. JURY TRIAL DAY 2. Case called at 8:38 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. DE will have Atty Schwab represent him today. Also appears in civilian clothes today. DA Nieskes makes statement. Atty Schwab addresses the motion filed by defendant regarding Detective Rose video. DA Nieskes responds and states point is mute and not planning on using as evidence. Jury present at 8:46 a.m. Court directs jurors that Atty Schwab will be representing DE today. State calls Darryl T. to the Stand. S/T Darryl T. Direct by ADA Walker. Witness excused. State calls Deputy Knudson to the Stand. S/T Scott Knudson. Employed as a Deputy with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by DA Nieskes. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Schwab. Witness excused. State calls Investigator Cary Rose to the Stand. S/T Cary Rose. Employed as an Investigator with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by DA Nieskes. PL Exhibit's #18-#23 (photographs of inmates). O/R Exhibit's #18-#23. Cross by Atty Schwab. SIDE BAR. Redirect by DA Nieskes. Witness excused. State calls Sargent Jill Miller to the Stand. S/T Jill Miller. Employed with the St Croix County Jail. Direct by DA Nieskes. Jury excused at 9:16 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. Atty Schwab moves for a mistrial. DA Nieskes responds. Court DENIES request for mistrial. Court considering a curative instruction. DA Nieskes objects. Atty Schwab would like to reserve on response. Jury present and case recalled at 9:21 a.m. Continued direct by DA Nieskes. Witness excused. State has no further witnesses or evidence and will rest. Jury excused at 9:23 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. Atty Schwab requesting a brief recess with his client. Court will recess at 9:24 a.m. Case recalled at 9:39 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. Atty Schwab states the defense will reset. DE will not testify. Court reviews rights with DE to testify and to remain silent. DE understands rights and wishes to remain silent. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Evidence is now closed. Court reviews Jury Instructions with parties. On the record outside the presence of the jury at 10:10 a.m. Parties discuss final jury instructions. Jury present and on the record at 10:33 a.m. Court reads Jury Instructions to jurors. SIDE BAR. Closing argument by DA Nieskes. Closing argument by Atty Schwab. Rebuttal by DA Nieskes at 11:35 a.m. Closing Instructions given to the jurors at 11:43 a.m. Oath to Bailiff given at 11:48 a.m. Court discloses alternate juror. Jury excused to deliberate at 11:49 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. No objections or any issue to put on the record. Court recesses. On the record at 12:49 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Jurors have a question. Parties agree on answer. Court recesses at 12:55 p.m. Case recalled at 1:09 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Jurors have several questions. Parties agree on answers. Court recesses at 1:12 p.m. Case recalled and jury present at 3:41 p.m. Jury has a Verdict:
Count 1: GUILTY
Count 2: NOT GUILTY
Count 3: GUILTY
Count 4: GUILTY
Count 5: GUILTY
Count 6: NOT GUILTY
Count 7: GUILTY
Count 8: GUILTY

Court polls Jury. Jury excused at 3:46 p.m. DA Nieskes requesting to revoke bond . Atty Schwab requesting cash bond to remain. Court will enter judgment per the Verdicts. Will revoke bond. Order PSI. PSI to be completed by 08-18-2017

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes and ADA Kaley Walker DF:  Chad William Kessler appeared from jail, pro se. Atty Don Schwab appears as standby counsel. JURY TRIAL DAY 1. Case called at 8:33 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court received DE's Motion in Limine. Also, Court addresses DE's attire. DE states it's his right and will continue in his attire. Court reviews process with DE. DA Nieskes would like to address DE's Motion in Limine. Regarding Motion to Dismiss Ct. 7, State files an amended information. Count 7 amended to a Class I Felony. Regarding second Motion in Limine, DA Nieskes makes statement. Court will reserve on that Motion at this time regarding video. DA Nieskes addresses issue regarding prior counsel Atty Schwab. Court will reserve on that issue and will address if issue comes up. DE addresses Jury Instructions. Court will address Jury Instructions at the end of trial. Case recalled and jury present at 9:10 a.m. Court conducts Voir Dire at 9:11 a.m. Oath of Jurors as to Qualifications given at 9:11 a.m. Jury selection at 9:12 a.m. 21 jurors to be called at this time. Voir Dire by DA Nieskes at 9:47 a.m. DE would like to remain silent on Voir Dire. Peremptory Strike at 10:03 a.m. OFF RECORD. DA Nieskes requesting all jurors be excused from the courtroom. On the record at 10:05 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. DA Nieskes makes statement regarding Juror #664. Not requesting any additional Voir Dire. DE is not requesting any additional Voir Dire of Juror #664. Court rules that Voir Dire is complete. Jury present and on the record. Peremptory Strike at 10:10 a.m. DE forfeiting right regarding peremptory strike. Atty Schwab has discussed matter with DE. State is requesting Court choose the other four jurors. Court gives the peremptory strike list to the jury clerk to remove four jurors. Court will take a recess at 10:20 a.m. Case recalled with the jury present at 10:36 a.m. Jury selected at 10:37 a.m. Oath of Jurors for Trial given at 10:38 a.m. Jury excused at 10:39 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. State has a motion for sequestration of witnesses. Victim's request to be present in the courtroom. Court will grant request for sequestration of witnesses and will allow victim's to be present in the courtroom. DE wishes to continue pro se. Case recalled with the jury present at 10:56 a.m. Opening Instructions given by the court at 10:57 a.m. Opening statement by the State at 11:09 a.m. Opening statement by DE at 11:17 a.m. State calls Katie B. to the Stand. S/T Katie B. Direct by DA Nieskes. Previously marked PL's Exhibit's #1,#2,#3 and #4 (photographs of truck). O/R Exhibit's #1-#4. Previously received on 06-12-17. Cross by Mr. Kessler. Redirect by DA Nieskes. Witness excused. State calls Nathan B. to the Stand. S/T Nathan B. Direct by DA Nieskes. Witness excused. State calls Chad G. to the Stand. S/T Chad G. Employed with the Village of Baldwin P.D. Direct by DA Nieskes. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. PL Exhibit #5 (photograph of inside of vehicle). PL Exhibit's #6 & #7 (photographs of inside of vehicle). O/R Exhibit's #5, #6 and #7. Witness excused but not released from subpoena. Jury excused at 11:51 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. State requesting the court provide a curative instruction regarding DE's opening statement. DE does not object. Court will give an explanation to the jurors after break. Court recesses at 11:56 a.m. Case recalled at 12:55 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court reviewed DE's opening statement and will DENY State's request for a curative instruction. State reviews Witness List and time line. Jury present and back on the record at 1:00 p.m. State calls Deputy Dustin G. to the Stand. S/T Dustin G. Employed as a Deputy with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Walker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by DE. Witness excused. State calls Deputy Kingsbury to the Stand. S/T Sheila K. Employed with the St Croix County Jail. Direct by DA Nieskes. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. PL Exhibit #8 ( 4 page Exhibit List). PL Exhibit #9 (photograph of jewelry & slumberland card). PL Exhibit #10 (photograph of Best Buy and Slumberland Card). PL Exhibit #11 (photograph of pen). Cross by DE. Redirect by DA Nieskes. Follow up by DE. Witness excused. Jury excused at 1:32 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. DA Nieskes requesting PL Exhibit's #8, #9, #10 and #11. O/R Exhibit's #8-#11. Court will recess at 1:34 p.m. Case recalled with jury present at 1:48 p.m. State wishes to play video deposition Joe Spah. Disc marked as PL Exhibit #12 (video deposition of Joe Spah). O/R Exhibit #12. State plays video deposition of Brandy Hart. Disc marked as PL Exhibit #13(video deposition of Brandy Hart). O/R Exhibit #13. State calls Investigator Haefner to the Stand. S/T James Haefner. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by DA Nieskes. Cross by Mr. Kessler. Witness excused. State calls Deputy Sykora to the Stand. S/T Jason Sykora. Employed as Patrol Deputy with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by DA Nieskes. Cross by Mr. Kessler. Witness excused. State calls Deputy Ryan to the Stand. S/T Steve Ryan. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Dept. Direct by DA Nieskes. PL Exhibit #14 (Photograph if black jewelry box). PL Exhibit #15 (Photograph of items found on rafter). O/R #14 & #15. Cross by DE. Witness excused. State requesting a brief recess to line up witnesses. Jury excused at 2:24 p.m. Court will recess at 2:25 p.m. Case recalled at 2:41 p.m. with the jury present. State calls Megan W. to the Stand. S/T Megan W. Direct by ADA Walker. PL Exhibit #16 (Photograph of Best Buy Credit Card) and PL Exhibit #17 (Photograph of frozen food items from chest freezer). Cross by Mr. Kessler. Witness excused. State calls Mitchell W. to the Stand. S/T Mitchell W. Direct by ADA Walker. Witness excused. O/R Exhibit's #16 and #17. State requesting court recess for the date due to witness availability. Jury to report tomorrow at 8:30 a.m. Court will recess at 2:59 p.m.
of Right to Attorney signed by Def on 6/13/17. sf
filed by Atty Schwab re: def wish to represent himself. sf

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nathan or Katy B. or residence, Offices of St Paul City of Public Works, Darrell Terpstra or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
